text: Does someone have an idea how I would be able to add a 'javascript:alert;' to a link in a rich text field?
and call it on the hyperlink? ``` <a href="javascript:AlertIt();">click me</a> ```
or you can make a class that you put on the hyperlink and in the JS file whenever you click that class fire an alert?
there are quite a few options

you can also do this: ``` <a href="http://alerted.alert/"
 onclick="return alert('Alerted');">click me</a> ```

This is almost what I'm trying to do now:
```<a href="javascript:alert('You successfully opted out of Google Analytics data processing');" id="ga-opt-out">Deactivate Google Analytics Data Collection</a>```

But all I am getting on my staging site is the id part
And of course the text but no <a href>
try this: ``` <a href="#" onclick="alert('You successfully opted out of Google Analytics data processing');" id="ga-opt-out">Deactivate Google Analytics Data Collection</a> ```
ok thank.... giving it a go now
and this is HubSpot's reply for your way of doing it <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-pages-editor/why-is-my-html-disappearing-from-my-rich-text-module>
Is not wrong but some functions are not supported by the rich text.

Hi all â€“ wondering if it is possible to use an email template that pulls an RSS feed for the latest blog post, but have the ability to add a custom post summary (as opposed to the one it pulls by default).
